big_picture_notes: Often considered Paul’s earliest extant letter, 1 Thessalonians follows a modified Hellenistic epistolary pattern: Salutation (1:1), extended Thanksgiving/Personal Narrative (1:2–3:13), Hortatory/Didactic instructions (4:1–5:22), and Conclusion (5:23–28). Literary glue includes the triad faith–love–hope (1:3; 5:8), frequent second‑person plural address, family metaphors, and the programmatic turn ‘Finally, then’ (4:1) from narrative to instruction. Eschatological hope in the Parousia motivates the ethical exhortations.

stories.story_title: The Apostolic Relationship and Foundational Narrative
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (1:1) formal salutation; end (3:13) climactic prayer/wish after Timothy’s report, completing the relational/narrative arc before the 4:1 exhortation turn. Glue: faith–love–hope refrain, family metaphors (mother/father/children), and repeated witness appeals (‘you know…’).

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Salutation moves into thanksgiving; closes with Spirit‑empowered reception and apostolic conduct. Devices: faith‑love‑hope triad, divine authentication, ‘you know’ refrain.

scenes.scene_name: The Model of the Thessalonians’ Faith
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Imitators→example→witness; ends with waiting for the Son from heaven. Devices: amplification (‘gone forth everywhere’), conversion narrative, future hope.
‘You know…’ defense against vanity, deceit, flattery. Devices: contrastive negatives, inclusio by witness appeals.

scenes.scene_name: Character and Dedication of the Apostles
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Nursing‑mother gentleness and fatherly exhortation; aim: walk worthy of God. Devices: dual parental metaphors, non‑burdensome labor motif.
Thanksgiving renewed for receiving God’s word; parallel with Judean churches; judgment note. Devices: chiasm on ‘word of God’, historical parallelism.
Torn‑away separation, desire to see them; they are hope/joy/crown at coming. Devices: personification, rhetorical Q&A, Parousia focus.
‘When we could bear it no longer…’ send Timothy to establish/exhort. Devices: causal ‘therefore’, anxiety/temptation concern.

scenes.scene_name: Joy and Supplication on Timothy’s Return
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Good report produces joy amid affliction; desire to supply what is lacking. Devices: report→response pattern, joy vs affliction contrast, sustained prayer.
Double optative wish; love increase → hearts established in holiness at Christ’s coming. Devices: parallelism, benedictory climax.

stories.story_title: Instructions for Holy Living and the Day of the Lord
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (4:1) ‘Finally, then’ signals hortatory body; end (5:22) closes rapid‑fire imperatives. Glue: ‘walk’ language (4:1, 12), peri de topic shifts (4:13; 5:1), and ethical/eschatological pairing (purity, love/work, resurrection hope, vigilance).

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Pivot from narrative to command; reminder of received instructions. Devices: intensified urgency (‘ask and urge’), authority appeal.
God’s will = sanctification; abstain from immorality; Spirit‑grounded warning. Devices: causal argument, holiness/honor contrast, divine authority close.
Peri de brotherly love; excel still more; live quietly, work, walk properly. Devices: inclusio (taught by God/already doing), outward witness aim.

scenes.scene_name: Hope for the Dead in Christ
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Peri de the asleep; Parousia sequence; comfort one another. Devices: narrative eschatology, consolation purpose.

scenes.scene_name: The Unexpected Day of the Lord
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Peri de times/seasons; thief‑in‑night metaphor; children of day. Devices: analogy, light/dark antithesis, identity grounding.
Do not sleep; be sober; armor of faith‑love‑hope; mutual upbuilding. Devices: sleep/wake and military metaphors, encourage/build up inclusio.
Acknowledge those who labor/lead/admonish; esteem highly; be at peace. Devices: leadership triad and response triad.
Admonish, encourage, help, be patient; do good; rejoice/pray/thank. Devices: imperative chain, climactic spiritual triplet (rejoice, pray, give thanks).
Do not quench Spirit or despise prophecies; test, hold fast; abstain from evil. Devices: balanced prohibitions/positives, concise closure command.

stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (5:23) formal benediction/prayer; end (5:28) final grace wish. Glue: direct invocation of God, optative prayer language, brief parting commands and greetings.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: May God sanctify wholly; faithful caller will do it. Devices: comprehensive triplet (spirit, soul, body), divine‑faithfulness guarantee.
Pray for us; holy kiss; read to all; grace be with you. Devices: brief imperatives, communal greeting, grace formula close.
